item.description:
Time to get back out on those fabulous trails at Beaver Brook in Hollis NH.  This area is just full of beautiful views, ponds,... http://www.beaverbrook.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/education-corridor.pdf

Let's meet at 11:00AM at the "Dam Road" & "Wildlife Pond" trails parking lot entrance, located on Route 130 (about 1 ½  or 2 miles after crossing Route 122)

and Hike for about 3 - 4 hours, with plenty of breaks/stops along the trails.

Please know that my intent is to enjoy a casual afternoon in the woods, get a workout, enjoy everyone's company, but most important HAVE FUN!

RECOMMENDATIONS:  Wear waterproof or rugged shoes/boots the trails can be wet/muddy this time of year; Dress in layers for the november cold area and then comfortable after heating up during the hike; Bring plenty of water/fluids to keep hydrated and lunch/snack to fuel the body.

DIRECTIONS:  Route 3 to exit 6 Route 130 West towards Brookline, stay on Route 130 (approximately 8 ½ miles) and cross Route 122 (Main St), travel about 1 1/2 or 2 miles to trail parking lot on Right.

group.name: Meeting & Greeting in So. NH & the Merrimack Valley :)

item.name: Ponds Loop Hike at Beaver Brook from rt130
